ARABIC: وَلَمَنِ ٱنتَصَرَ بَعْدَ ظُلْمِهِۦ فَأُو۟لَٰٓئِكَ مَا عَلَيْهِم مِّن سَبِيلٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But if people do defend themselves when they are wronged, nothing can be held against them for doing that.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If one avenges himself after he has been wronged, there is no way of blaming him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: There is no blame against him who avenges himself after he has been wronged.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Those who successfully defend themselves after being wronged will not be questioned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And there is no way of reproach against those who take revenge after being wronged.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And indeed whosoever takes revenge after he has suffered wrong, for such there is no way (of blame) against them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And whoever defends himself after his being oppressed, these it is against whom there is no way (to blame).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And whosoever helps himself after he has been wronged -- against them there is no way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And whoso defendeth himself after he hath suffered wrong - for such, there is no way (of blame) against them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Those who defend themselves after they have been wronged cannot be held blameworthy,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And whosoever vindicateth him self after wrong done him these! against them there is no way of blame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: As for those who retaliate after being wronged, there is no ground for action against them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But indeed if any do help and defend themselves after a wrong (done) to them, against such there is no cause of blame.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And indeed whosoever takes revenge after he has suffered wrong, for such there is no way (of blame) against them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And whosoever harms after he has been harmed there is no blame upon them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: As for those who retaliate after being wronged, there is no blame on them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And whoever avenges himself after having been wronged - those have not upon them any cause [for blame].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [42:41] And whoever defends himself after he has been wronged, that is to say, after the wrongdoer has wronged him — for such, there will be no course [of action] against them, no blame [on them].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And whoso defendeth himself) and he who reclaims his right through the law of retaliation (after he hath suffered wrong for such, there is no way (of blame) against them) i.e. by applying the law of retaliation against them.
